meanings.sent1: She accidentally got a smudge of chocolate on her shirt.
meanings.sent2: The artist's hand left a smudge of paint on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous toddler left a smudge of jelly on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The smudge of ink on the paper seemed to dance in the light.
meanings.sent5: The smudge on the mirror was a reminder of yesterday's playtime.

meanings.definition: To make a dirty mark or smear on (a surface).
meanings.sent1: Please be careful not to smudge the freshly painted wall.
meanings.sent2: She used her finger to smudge the charcoal on the paper.
meanings.sent3: He tried to smudge the evidence of his mistake, but it was still visible.
meanings.sent4: The rain began to smudge the lines of the drawing on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent5: The chef accidentally smudged the frosting on the cake with his sleeve.

meanings.sent1: The photograph had a smudge in the corner that distorted the image.
meanings.sent2: The fog created a smudge on the horizon, making it hard to see.
meanings.sent3: The smudge on the glasses made everything look fuzzy.
meanings.sent4: The smudge of dust on the lens gave the photo a dreamy quality.
meanings.sent5: The smudge on the window made the view outside look like a painting.
